sentence.content: Pneumonia-stricken actress Elizabeth Taylor has suffered complications in her fifth week of hospitalization, including new infections, and doctors now say she will be hospitalized six more weeks.
sentence.syntactictree: (ROOT (S (S (NP (JJ Pneumonia-stricken) (NN actress) (NNP Elizabeth) (NNP Taylor)) (VP (VBZ has) (VP (VBN suffered) (NP (NNS complications)) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (PRP$ her) (JJ fifth) (NN week)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NN hospitalization))))) (, ,) (PP (VBG including) (NP (JJ new) (NNS infections)))))) (, ,) (CC and) (S (NP (NNS doctors)) (ADVP (RB now)) (VP (VBP say) (SBAR (S (NP (PRP she)) (VP (MD will) (VP (VB be) (VP (VBN hospitalized) (NP (CD six) (JJR more) (NNS weeks))))))))) (. .)))

sentence.content: The recovery of Miss Taylor, near death two weeks ago with a viral pneumonia, has been complicated by bacterial pneumonia and a yeast infection, her doctors said today.
sentence.syntactictree: (ROOT (S (S (NP (NP (DT The) (NN recovery)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNP Miss) (NNP Taylor))) (, ,) (PP (IN near) (NP (NP (NN death)) (PP (ADVP (NP (CD two) (NNS weeks)) (IN ago)) (IN with) (NP (DT a) (JJ viral) (NN pneumonia))))) (, ,)) (VP (VBZ has) (VP (VBN been) (VP (VBN complicated) (PP (IN by) (NP (NP (JJ bacterial) (NN pneumonia)) (CC and) (NP (DT a) (NN yeast) (NN infection)))))))) (, ,) (NP (PRP$ her) (NNS doctors)) (VP (VBD said) (NP-TMP (NN today))) (. .)))

sentence.content: "Miss Taylor has a resolving, newly acquired bacterial pneumonia secondary to her hospital stay at St. John&apost;s Hospital and Health Center," the doctors said in Santa Monica through Taylor&apost;s publicist, Chen Sam.

sentence.content: "She has also developed a fungemia of Candida albicans (infection in the blood), more commonly referred to as yeast and will be hospitalized for approximately six more weeks for intravenous therapy," the doctors added without elaboration.

sentence.content: Bacterial pneumonia is generally considered less serious than the viral pneumonia Taylor initially contracted because antibiotics are effective against bacteria but not viruses.
